SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part III, Line 4 Collections of art - description of collections
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Collections from various scholars, dignitaries, and artists enhance the intellectual atmosphere on campus.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part IV, Line 2b Explanation of escrow agreement
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The College holds cash for student campus organizations, which are funded by an Activity Fee on student's tuition statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 Intended uses of endowment funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The endowment provides support for the operation of the college and helps the college fulfill its mission by providing scholarships and faculty support.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2 FIN 48 (ASC 740) footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The College is exempt from federal income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the United States Internal Revenue Code. The College is not considered to be a private foundation. Current accounting standards require the College to disclose the amount of potential benefit or obligation to be realized as a result of an examination performed by a taxing authority. For the years ended June 30, 2022 and 2021, management has determined that the College does not have any tax positions that result in any uncertainties regarding the possible impact on the College's financial statements. The College does not expect the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits to significantly change in the next 12 months. The College recognizes interest and/or penalties related to income tax matters in income tax expense. The College did not have any amounts accrued for interest and penalties at June 30, 2022 or 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 3 RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Franklin College is committed to the principle and practice of equal opportunity for all its students, faculty, employees and applicants for admission and employment. For that reason, the college provides equal employment opportunities to all of its employees and applicants on the basis of merit and without regard to the individual's race, color, religion, gender, disability, age, national origin, marital status, or sexual orientation in accordance with state and federal laws and any other characteristic protected by law. The college prohibits, forbids, and will not tolerate any verbal, physical or other conduct that belittles or demeans any individual on the basis of the above-listed statuses. All employees, managers, supervisors and job applicants are covered by this commitment. No person or employee, no matter what his or her title or position, has the authority expressed, actual, apparent or implied to discriminate against any employee of the college. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, admission to and enrollment in Franklin College, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, hiring, benefits, educational policies, admission policies, financial aid, scholarship and loan programs, housing athletic and other college-administered programs and activities. Franklin College posts the nondiscrimination policy on its website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 6(a) FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization receives Pell Grants, SEOG, HEERF and Work Study funds from the federal government. The organization also receives funds from the State of Indiana which include 21st Century, Freedom of Choice, and other Hoosier scholarships and/or grants.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Financial Aid Office and Business Office operate together to ensure grants are used for educational purposes. Grants are applied to students' accounts by the Business Office after the grants are approved and disbursed by the Financial Aid Office.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Travel for companions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Travel expenses for the President's spouse are paid by the College when accompanying him during travel. The spouse is expected to be in attendance for fundraising events, meetings with trustees, and various meetings. This is not treated as taxable compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Health or social club dues or initiation fees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Club dues are paid for the President. All are treated as taxable compensation and appear on the Forms W-2 for these individuals.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1b Written policy regarding payment or reimbursement of expenses
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Trustees determines eligibility for these benefits for the President. The President approves reimbursement for all other staff/faculty positions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 7 Non-fixed payments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The President received incentive compensation for performance. The payment amount was designated by the Board.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Partner of Bemis Group and Garment Factory Events, LLC

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part III GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE BENEFITTING INTERESTED PERSONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PER IRS INSTRUCTIONS, COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES, AND PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOLS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO IDENTIFY INTERESTED PERSONS TO WHOM THEY PROVIDED SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND SIMILAR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. INSTEAD, THESE ORGANIZATIONS MUST, IN PART III, GROUP EACH TYPE OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE (FOR EXAMPLE, NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS, DISCOUNTED TUITION) PROVIDED TO INTERESTED PERSONS IN SEPARATE LINES. FOR EACH LINE, THE SCHOOL SHOULD REPORT IN COLUMN (C) THE AGGREGATE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF EACH TYPE OF ASSISTANCE, THE TYPE OF ASSISTANCE IN COLUMN (D), AND THE PURPOSE OF THE ASSISTANCE IN COLUMN (E), UNLESS SUCH REPORTING WOULD BE AN UNAUTHORIZED DISCLOSURE OF STUDENT EDUCATION RECORDS UNDER THE FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA). COLUMNS (A) AND (B) SHOULD BE LEFT BLANK FOR THESE LINES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I Explanations of reporting method for number of contributions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Securities - Publicly traded - The number of contributions Received Other - Supplies The number of contributions received Real estate - Other - Agricultural undeveloped land The number of contributions Received

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b PROCESS USED TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR ALL EMPLOYEES AND OTHER OFFICERS OF THE COLLEGE. ON OCCASION, THE PRESIDENT USES COMPARABILITY DATA FROM THE INDEPENDENT COLLEGES OF INDIANA, CUPA, AND SALARY SURVEYS TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION AS NEEDED. THIS PROCESS IS COMPLETED ANNUALLY AND WAS LAST UNDERTAKEN IN 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 1a Delegate broad authority to a committee
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee shall be composed of the Chairman, the immediate past chairman, the ten Vice-Chairs, the Secretary, and the Treasurer, all ex officio with vote. The President shall be a member ex officio without vote. The Chairman of the Board shall serve as Chairman of the Executive Committee. At the call of the Chairman, the committee shall meet between regular meetings of the Board for the purpose of expediting orders of the Board of Trustees and overseeing the approved program and development of the College. The Executive Committee shall have and may exercise, during the intervals between the meetings of the Board of Trustees, all powers vested in the Board of Trustees, but actions taken by the executive committee may be subject to review.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2 Family/business relationships amongst interested persons
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SUSAN DEVOSS AND ROBERT DEVOSS - Family relationship

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is reviewed by the audit committee. Then a copy of the form 990 is provided to every member of the governing body before it is filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All employees and Trustees annually sign a conflict of interest statement. The President is responsible for reviewing the statements for College employees. The Audit Committee is responsible for reviewing the statements of the Trustees and the President. Any Board member conflicts of interest that are disclosed are reported to the Chair of the Board who ensures the individual abstains from voting on matters related to the conflict.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The President's Committee of the Board of Trustees establishes the President's compensation annually. This is done through a review process by which the President's performance is assessed. The Committee uses comparative salary data, including Forms 990 of other organizations, to make its final decision. The decision is then recommended to the Board of Trustees. The Board then votes on the matter. The deliberations and decisions are documented in the board minutes. This process was last undertaken in 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT REQUIRED DISCLOSURES PURSUANT TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) SECTION 6104. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THIS TIME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule R, Part IV, Column (c) STATE OF LEGAL DOMICILE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIANA - 3 WASHINGTON - 1
